'''Geoff James Nugent''' (born 14 February 1977),<ref name="swerve">{{Cite press release |url=http://www.calgaryherald.com/Five+facts+about+Jefferies/10317847/story.html |title=Five facts about Jim Jefferies |first=Jon |last=Roe |publisher=Swerve Management via ''[[Calgary Herald]]'' |date=23 October 2014 |accessdate=14 October 2016 |archivedate=14 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6lFIU4fZ3?url=http://www.calgaryherald.com/Five+facts+about+Jefferies/10317847/story.html |deadurl=no |df=}}</ref> known professionally as '''Jim Jefferies''' (and previously '''Jim Jeffries'''), is an Australian stand-up comedian, political commentator, actor, and writer. Alongside his stand-up comedy, Jefferies is best known for his work in [[Television in the United States|American television]], creating and starring in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] sitcom ''[[Legit (2013 TV series)|Legit]]'' from 2013â€“2014 and [[Comedy Central]]'s late-night comedy ''[[The Jim Jefferies Show]]'' since 2017.
== Early life ==
Born in [[Sydney|Sydney, Australia]],<ref>{{Cite AV media |url=https://art19.com/shows/the-jim-jefferies-show-podcast/episodes/be389a38-5e0b-4be6-b819-8da074c45ce7 |title=The Jim Jefferies Show Podcast - Kaepernick, Chickens & Fisting |time=31:29 |website=ART19 |date=27 September 2017}}</ref> as Geoff James Nugent,<ref name="swerve" /> he initially took the stage name Jim Jeffries but amended the last name to Jefferies to avoid confusion with a similarly named American performer. His father was a cabinetmaker and maintenance worker from [[Roma, Queensland]],<ref name="themusic"/> and his mother was a substitute teacher.<ref name="vice"/> Jefferies grew up in [[Sydney]],<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/comedy/controversial-comic-jim-jefferies-promises-to-offend-20150325-1m75ah.html |title=Controversial comic Jim Jefferies promises to offend |work=The Sydney Morning Herald |last=Northover |first=Kylie |date=25 March 2015 |accessdate=26 August 2017}}</ref> before moving to Perth to study musical theatre and classical music at the [[Western Australian Academy of Performing Arts]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/arts/review/comedian-jim-jefferies-finally-finds-success-at-home/news-story/b6c2c95c9219a65227e950c24730c6ca |title=Comedian Jim Jefferies finally finds success at home |work=The Australian (paywalled) |last=Bodey |first=Michael |date=12 April 2014 |accessdate=26 August 2017}}</ref> He began his stand-up comedy career once he left the Academy several months before completing his degree,<ref name="themusic">{{Cite web |url=http://themusic.com.au/interviews/all/2015/03/26/jim-jefferies-steve-bell/ |title="At Least A Million People In Australia Fucking Hate Me!" |work=themusic.com.au |last=Bell |first=Steve |date=26 March 2015 |accessdate=26 August 2017}}</ref> relocating initially to Sydney and then to the United Kingdom.<ref name="vice">{{Cite web |url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/newggb/jim-jefferies-hated-going-to-school-with-his-mother |title=Jim Jefferies Hated Going to School with His Mother |work=Vice |last=Fitzmaurice |first=Larry |date=22 June 2017 |accessdate=26 August 2017}}</ref>
== Career ==
=== Stand-up ===
Jefferies first achieved international attention in 2007, when he was attacked onstage while performing at the [[The Comedy Store (London)|Manchester Comedy Store]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/news/2007/04/16/5226/comic_attacked_on_stage |title=Comic attacked on stage |publisher=Chortle.co.uk |date=16 April 2007 |accessdate=5 April 2012 |archivedate=14 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6lFIpkGzK?url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/news/2007/04/16/5226/comic_attacked_on_stage |deadurl=no |df=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite podcast |url=http://wzlx.cbslocal.com/2011/09/16/jim-jeffries-how-i-got-a-scar-on-the-back-of-my-head/ |title=Jim Jeffries: How I got a scar on the back of my head |publisher=[[WZLX-FM]] |location=Boston, Massachusetts |date=6 September 2011 |accessdate=4 February 2016 |archivedate=14 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6lFIxUjlZ?url=http://wzlx.cbslocal.com/2011/09/16/jim-jeffries-how-i-got-a-scar-on-the-back-of-my-head/ |deadurl=no |df=}}</ref> Footage of the incident was incorporated into the comedian's act and can be seen on his 2008 DVD, ''Contraband''. He became well known in the [[United States]] in 2009, after his debut [[HBO]] special, ''I Swear to God''.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.hbo.com/comedy/jim-jefferies-i-swear-to-god/index.html |title=''Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God'' |publisher=[[HBO]] |accessdate=5 April 2012}}</ref>
Jefferies has performed at numerous festivals, including the [[Edinburgh Festival Fringe]], [[Just for Laughs]] Festival, [[Melbourne International Comedy Festival]], [[Reading and Leeds Festivals]] and the [[Glastonbury Festival]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2017}} Jefferies has also performed spots on ''The World Stands Up'', ''Comedy Blue'' and ''Edinburgh and Beyond'' for [[Comedy Central]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2017}}
Following the release of his [[Netflix]] special, ''Freedumb'', in July 2016, Jefferies has been performing ''The Unusual Punishment Tour'' with all-new material,<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://jimjefferies.com/blog/427588/jim-jefferies-announces-the-unusual-punishment-tou |title=Jim Jefferies Announces The Unusual Punishment Tour |publisher=Jim Jefferies |accessdate=13 June 2017}}</ref> and filmed his most recent comedy special "This Is Me Now," at the [[Hammersmith Apollo]] in [[London]], in January 2018.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.timeout.com/london/comedy/jim-jefferies-the-unusual-punishment |title=Jim Jefferies: The Unusual Punishment |website=Time Out London |date=9 October 2017 |access-date=2 November 2017}}</ref>
=== Acting ===
In February 2014 he starred in a low budget Australian feature film called ''[[Me and My Mates vs the Zombie Apocalypse]]'' with Australian comedians [[Greg Fleet]] and Alex Williamson, which premiered in Australian cinemas on 25 July 2015.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2846938 |title=Me and My Mates vs. The Zombie Apocalypse (2015) |date=14 April 2015 |work=IMDb}}</ref> It was released in DVD and on [[Vimeo]] in Australia and New Zealand in late 2015,<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://titanview.com/index.php/films/out-now/me-and-my-mates-vs-the-zombie-apocalypse/item/me-and-my-mates-vs-the-zombie-apocalypse |title=Me And My Mates vs The Zombie Apocalypse |publisher=Titan View |year=2015 |accessdate=4 February 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160228155927/http://titanview.com/index.php/films/out-now/me-and-my-mates-vs-the-zombie-apocalypse/item/me-and-my-mates-vs-the-zombie-apocalypse |archivedate=28 February 2016 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> in the UK and Ireland on 2 May 2016 and was released in the US on 5 July 2016.
=== ''Jim and Eddie Talkin' Shit'' ===
From November 2010 to November 2012, Jefferies co-hosted the podcast ''Jim and Eddie Talkin' Shit'' with his fellow comedian and former roommate, [[Eddie Ifft]]. Jefferies had to quit because of his busy work schedule.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://twitter.com/jimjefferies/status/4650062802059264 |title=Jim Jefferies on Twitter - Starting ''Jim and Eddie Talkin' Shit'' |date=16 November 2010 |accessdate=13 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://twitter.com/jimjefferies/status/274617270762872832 |title=Jim Jefferies on Twitter - Leaving ''Jim and Eddie Talkin' Shit'' |date=30 November 2012 |accessdate=13 June 2017}}</ref>
=== ''Legit'' ===
Jefferies's comedy series ''[[Legit (2013 TV series)|Legit]]'' premiered on 17 January 2013 on [[FX (TV channel)|FX]]. A second season premiered on 26 February 2014, having been moved to [[FXX]].<ref>[http://www.fxx.com/legit ''Legit'' on FXX]</ref> The series received positive attention among the disabled community for its portrayal of people with mental and physical disabilities.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Couch |first=Aaron |title=How FX's 'Legit' Became the Darling of the Disabled Community |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/fxs-legit-jim-jefferies-embraced-430325 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=28 April 2013}}</ref> The series was cancelled after two seasons.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Pedersen |first=Erik |url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/05/fxxs-legit-fxs-chozen-cancelled/ |title=FXX's 'Legit' & FX's 'Chozen' Cancelled |publisher=Deadline.com |date=14 May 2014 |accessdate=15 May 2014}}</ref>
=== ''The Jim Jefferies Show'' ===
On 3 March 2017, [[Comedy Central]] announced ''[[The Jim Jefferies Show]]'', a new ten-episode weekly series,<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://press.cc.com/press-release/2017/03/03/press-jim-jefferies-brings-inquisitive-and-international-point-of-view-to-comedy-central-in-new-weekly-late-night-series |title=Jim Jefferies Brings Inquisitive and International Point of View to Comedy Central in New Weekly Late Night Series |publisher=Comedy Central Press |date=3 March 2017 |accessdate=9 June 2017}}</ref> that premiered on 6 June 2017.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://press.cc.com/press-release/2017/05/09/the-jim-jefferies-show-debuts-tuesday-june-6-at-1030-pm |title=The Jim Jefferies Show Debuts Tuesday 6 June at 1030 PM |publisher=Comedy Central Press |date=9 May 2017 |accessdate=10 May 2017}}</ref> Jefferies, hosting the show, takes a look on culture and politics behind his desk, and travels around the world to tackle the weekâ€™s top stories and most controversial issues. On 25 July 2017, the first season was extended with ten additional episodes,<ref>{{Cite web |last=Otterson |first=Joe |url=https://variety.com/2017/tv/news/comedy-central-president-show-jim-jefferies-show-hasan-minaj-1202506006/ |title=Comedy Central Orders More â€˜President Show,â€™ â€˜Jim Jefferies Showâ€™ |website=Variety |date=25 July 2017 |accessdate=26 July 2017}}</ref> that completed airing on 21 November 2017. On 15 January 2018, Comedy Central renewed the series for a twenty-episode second season,<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Petski |first1=Denise |title=â€˜The Jim Jefferies Showâ€™ Renewed For Second Season By Comedy Central |url=http://deadline.com/2018/01/the-jim-jefferies-show-renewed-second-season-comedy-central-1202243295/ |website=Deadline |accessdate=15 January 2018 |date=15 January 2018}}</ref> which premiered on 27 March 2018.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/video/2018/02/14/video-a-valentines-day-message-from-jim-jefferies-season-2-of-the-jim-jefferies-show-premieres-march-27-on-comedy-central-189301/20180214comedycentral01/ |title=Video: A Valentine's Day Message from Jim Jefferies - Season 2 of "The Jim Jefferies Show" Premieres 27 March on Comedy Central |date=14 February 2018 |website=TheFutonCritic.com |access-date=14 February 2018}}</ref>
=== Other work === Jefferies has appeared on comedy panel shows such as ''[[Never Mind the Buzzcocks]]'', ''[[Have I Got News for You]]'', ''[[The Heaven and Earth Show]]'' and ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'', the US comedy panel show ''[[The Green Room with Paul Provenza]]'' and Comedy Central's ''[[@midnight]]''. He has also been featured on various radio programmes, including [[BBC Radio 5 Live]]'s Saturday morning sports show, ''[[Opie and Anthony]]'', and ''[[Fighting Talk]]''.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/fivelive/programmes/fightingtalk.shtml BBC Radio 5 live â€“ Fighting Talk]. BBC Online. Retrieved on 5 April 2012.</ref>
== Personal life ==
Jefferies was previously in a relationship with actress Kate Luyben.<ref>{{Cite AV media |url=https://art19.com/shows/the-jim-jefferies-show-podcast/episodes/5b03c530-5d73-4979-ba8d-5aa479c0359f |title=The Jim Jefferies Show Podcast - Prohibition, Clowns & Dr. Zeus |time=24:38 |website=ART19 |date=4 October 2017}}</ref> Together, they have a son named Hank, born in November 2012.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/culture/theatre/interview-jim-jefferies-comedian-1-2453023 |title=Interview: Jim Jefferies, comedian |last=Randall |first=Lee |date=6 August 2012 |work=The Scotsman |access-date=24 December 2017 |language=en}}</ref> Jefferies describes himself as an [[atheist]].<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=679719178480189440 |user=jimjefferies |title=I'm an atheist who loves Christmas it's a very confusing time of year for me. |author=Jim Jefferies |date=23 December 2015}}</ref>
